com.steelypip.powerups.jinxml

Interface Builder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventHandler, Iterator<Element>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StdBuilder

    public interface Builder
extends Iterator<Element>, EventHandler

    • Method Summary

      boolean hasNext()
      returns true if enough events have been received to construct an element.

      Processes a series of events, which is effectively the same as events.forEach( e -< this.processEvent( e ) ).
      default void reconstruct(Element value)
      Replays a series of events which would construct the Element supplied but does so inside the in-progress build.
      Element snapshot()
      All open states are automatically but temporarily completed; if an Element is ready for construction after the auto-completion, it is constructed and the result will be returned, otherwise an exception is raised; the temporarily closed states are restored to their previous state.

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        boolean hasNext()
        returns true if enough events have been received to construct an element.
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface Iterator<Element>
        Returns:
        flag saying if it is safe to call next()

      • isInProgress

        boolean isInProgress()
        return true if some events have been received but there are more open than close events. Note that a Builder starts off as in progress.
        Returns:
        true unless a complete set of events have been received.

      • next

        Element next()
        constructs the next Element if one is ready for construction, otherwise will raise an exception. Use this.hasNext() to determine whether it is safe to call this method.
        Specified by:
        next in interface Iterator<Element>
        Returns:
        the next Element

      • next

        Element next(boolean mutable)
        constructs the next Element if one is ready for construction, otherwise will raise an exception. Use this.hasNext() to determine whether it is safe to call this method.
        Parameters:
        mutable - if true then the result is deeply mutable, else deeply immutable
        Returns:
        the next Element

      • tryNext

        default Element tryNext(Element otherwise)
        If an Element is ready for construction it builds and returns it, otherwise it returns the value otherwise instead.
        Parameters:
        otherwise - the value to be returned if the Builder is in progress.
        Returns:
        the element

      • tryNext

        Element tryNext(Element otherwise,
                boolean mutable)
        If an Element is ready for construction it builds and returns it, otherwise it returns the value otherwise instead.
        Parameters:
        otherwise - the value to be returned if the Builder is in progress.
        mutable - determines if the newly constructed element is deeply mutable or deeply immutable
        Returns:
        the element

      • tryNext

        default Element tryNext()

      • snapshot

        Element snapshot()
        All open states are automatically but temporarily completed; if an Element is ready for construction after the auto-completion, it is constructed and the result will be returned, otherwise an exception is raised; the temporarily closed states are restored to their previous state. Use this.isInProgress() to check whether it is safe to call this method.
        Returns:
        the element

      • trySnapshot

        Element trySnapshot(Element otherwise)
        As for snapshot but never raises an exception but returns the value otherwise instead.
        Parameters:
        otherwise - the value to return if there are
        Returns:
        the newly constructed element

      • newElement

        default Element newElement(boolean mutable)
        Closes the current element-under-construction and returns it. The mutability parameter overrides the default mutability of the builder and also the mutability of any included elements.
        Parameters:
        mutable - if true the result is deeply mutable, otherwise deeply immutable
        Returns:
        the new element

      • newElement

        default Element newElement()
        Closes the current element-under-construction and returns it. Mutability is decided by the default of the Builder.
        Returns:
        the new element

      • include

        default void include(Element value)
        Adds and shares this Element into the in-progress build with the default selector ("") and without checking mutability consistency.
        Parameters:
        value - value to include

      • include

        default void include(Element value,
                     boolean checkMutability)
        Adds and shares this Element into the in-progress build with the default selector (""). The mutability of the included value is checked depending on the checkMutability flag. It is not an error to mix mutability this way but an occasionally important feature.
        Parameters:
        value - value to include
        checkMutability - ensure that mutability is consistent

      • include

        void include(@NonNull String selector,
             Element value,
             boolean checkMutability)
        Adds and shares this Element into the in-progress build with a given selector. The mutability of the included value is checked depending on the checkMutability flag. It is not an error to mix mutability this way but an occasionally important feature.
        Parameters:
        selector - the selector
        value - value to include
        checkMutability - ensure that mutability is consistent

      • include

        default void include(@NonNull String selector,
                     Element value)

      • include

        default void include(Member member,
                     boolean checkMutablity)

      • include

        default void include(Member member)

      • reconstruct

        default void reconstruct(Element value)
        Replays a series of events which would construct the Element supplied but does so inside the in-progress build. This is effectively the same as this.processEvents( value.toEventIterator() ) a deep copy.
        Parameters:
        value - value to copy

      • processEvents

        default void processEvents(Stream<Event> events)
        Processes a series of events, which is effectively the same as events.forEach( e -< this.processEvent( e ) ).
        Parameters:
        events - the stream of events to process

      • processEvent

        default void processEvent(Event event)
        Handle a single event - uses visitor pattern to translate Event to call.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to handle

      • newBuilder

        static Builder newBuilder()
        A convenience method that creates a new default builder, which constructs immutable elements.
        Returns:
        a builder for Elements

      • newBuilder

        static Builder newBuilder(boolean mutable)
        A convenience method that creates a new default builder, which constructs elements. The elements are mutable/immutable depending on the flag mutable.
        Parameters:
        mutable - if true the constructed Events are mutable, other immutable
        Returns:
        a builder for Elements

      • newBuilder

        static Builder newBuilder(boolean mutable,
                          boolean allows_queuing)
        A convenience method that creates a new default builder, which constructs elements. The elements are mutable/immutable depending on the flag mutable. The builder allows the constructed elements to queue up internally if allow_queuing is true, otherwise the caller must be sure to retrieve the newly constructed element before others can be started.
        Parameters:
        mutable - if true the constructed Events are mutable, other immutable
        allows_queuing - if true then the builder can construct many elements before the caller tries to retrieve them.
        Returns:
        a builder for Elements
